title: A Roman honours his mother
support: A large rectangular block of shell-bearing limestone, intact on top, left, right and behind, but damaged below. Appears intact lower right underside, so the only significant loss/damage is the lower left corner. The left edge of the stone is clearly preserved, which implies at least one additional block originally stood to the left.

layout._: Two lines of large Latin letters, with a slight vacat above, filling the width of the stone.

provenanceFound._: Found in 1925 in material to the east of the 'Oratory of Phalaris' (Marconi writes "ritrovata tra le macerie a oriente del tempietto")

facsimile.desc: Photo J. Prag, courtesy Museo Regionale Archeologico Pietro Griffo

museum.name: Museo Regionale Archeologico Pietro Griffo
museum.description: Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered at the site of Agrigento and in Agrigento province, organised both by chronology and type across a number of rooms and corridors
museum.address:
Contrada San Nicola, 12
Valley of the Temples, 92100 - Agrigento (AG)
